name: Bioinformatics Club at Simon Fraser University
tagline: This is a new club that hopes to provide an environment for students and other academics to come together to talk about their work related to Bioinformatics. This club is meant for people at all stages of the learning curve of Bioinformatics. You can come and share questions that you may have of your research and/or of somebody else's research. And we hope to bring guest speakers to help us figure out the more problematic subjects of Bioinformatics.
body:
### Events  

**Westgrid workshop "Introduction to Next Generation Sequencing Analysis Part I: Short-read Mapping and Visualization"**  
*November 23, 2016 - 10:00 to 11:45, IRMACS room 10901*  
  Join us to watch the Next Generation Sequencing workshop put together by Westgrid "Introduction to   Next Generation Sequencing Analysis Part I: Short-read Mapping and Visualization". We will meet at   IRMACS room 10901 on Wednesday, November 23, 2016 - 10:00 to 11:45 PST  
  [Westgrid Workshop registration](https://www.westgrid.ca/events/introduction_next_generation_sequencing_analysis_part_i_shortread_mapping_and_visualization). Deadline to register is Friday, November 11

### Potential Session subjects for Spring 2017
* Gene Ontology Meaning and Best Practices. Suggested reading ["The Gene Ontology Handbook"](http://link.springer.com/book/10.1007%2F978-1-4939-3743-1)  
* Methods of normalizing RNA-Seq

### Links
[Scientific Programming Club at SFU](http://sciprog.ca/)   
[Westgrid events](https://www.westgrid.ca/events/)

### Contact us
Bioinformatics-Club-SFU@googlegroups.com
